item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, March 29, 2025 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Why Apple's Severance gets edited over remote desktop software (222 points | 144 comments)
2. Veloren – voxel action-adventure role-playing in Rust (123 points | 19 comments)
3. All of the Commercials That David Lynch Has Directed: A 30-Minute Compilation (15 points | 1 comment)
4. Accessible open textbooks in math-heavy disciplines (102 points | 32 comments)
5. Paged Out #6 is out (79 points | 6 comments)
6. Spark AI (YC W24) Is Hiring a Full-Stack Engineer in San Francisco ( | hide)
7. The Candid Naivety of Geeks (38 points | 13 comments)
8. Lvgl: Embedded graphics library to create beautiful UIs (25 points | 1 comment)
9. Matrix Calculus (For Machine Learning and Beyond) (14 points | 1 comment)
10. Vramfs: Vram Based Filesystem for Linux (55 points | 18 comments)
11. OSS-SEC: Three bypasses of Ubuntu's unprivileged user namespace restrictions (15 points | 1 comment)
12. Show HN: Physical Pomodoro Timer with ESP32 and e-paper screen (261 points | 59 comments)
13. The disappearance of Gaia, ESA spacecraft will be turned off on 27 March 2025 (9 points | discuss)
14. Free Output – AI output copyright status checker (16 points | 10 comments)
15. Real Time Chess – A physical chess board without the concept of turns (152 points | 24 comments)
16. Decline of cash credited for drop in surgery for children swallowing objects (23 points | 9 comments)
17. Postgres Language Server: Initial Release (252 points | 38 comments)
18. Typed Japanese (53 points | 14 comments)
19. Beautiful and Minimalistic Chrome Extension (5 points | discuss)
20. Show HN: I implemented Snake in a tmux config file (30 points | 1 comment)
21. Plain – a web framework for building products with Python (255 points | 146 comments)
22. The Wrong Way to Use a Signed Distance Function (SDF) (7 points | discuss)
23. Making of the New York and Erie Railroad Organizational Diagram (10 points | 2 comments)
24. Body Doubling (32 points | 3 comments)
25. We hacked Gemini's Python sandbox and leaked its source code (at least some) (617 points | 125 comments)
26. Low responsiveness of ML models to critical or deteriorating health conditions (75 points | 42 comments)
27. Show HN: Appear as anyone in video calls like zoom or Google meets (5 points | 4 comments)
28. Train and Weather Tracker with Raspberry Pi and E-Ink (4 points | discuss)
29. TSMC, Intel and other top chipmakers slow Japan, Malaysia expansions (28 points | 10 comments)
30. Portlander creates AI-powered device to monitor street health (12 points | 3 comments)
